title: What champions would fit me?
body: I am a man that appreciates movement, I prefer ranged champions but I wouldn't complain about Champions like Master Yi, Kassadin who have good speed and skills that allow them swiftness etc... I'm basically trying to find champions that best suit my play style but it hard because I consider myself versatile to a degree which make it hard to narrow things down I suppose. I can pick up basically any champ and play/learn them quickly etc... but of course there are certain champions that just "roll off the tongue" a lot better. Hmm... what are other ways to describe my play style; I honestly suck at explaining things sometimes :) I for sure like a challenge/a champion that I have to really work on, so I'm looking for medium - hard difficulty champions I suppose. I'm trying to branch out but I just don't where to start basically :)

That was the first champion that popped to my mind for ranged and mobile. LeBlanc would be up next.  Esp. if Wolf (op) is good at picking up champions. Those are difficult but rewarding ones.
Leblanc is not difficult. Kalista is pretty difficult though.

lulu {{champion:117}} can be pretty mobile, but she is very ranged, and since you like movement so much she has a 80% slow and her ultimate creates a aoe slow on the target, it may not be the easiest champion to carry as, but she is a fun enjoyable champ that Is hard to get bored playing and offers powerful team fighting potential

Pros:  
-versatile, can be played top/mid/jungle/adc/support (trust me, lulu adc is the thing) 
-disengage, nice counter for champs like {{champion:107}} 
-cc, the only champ in the game with polymorph
-mobile

Cons:
-no sudden hard burst dmg but more like sustained. 
-dependent on teamwork
-only 2 damaging abilities and you generally want to use e as a shield - which leaves you with only q.. 
-highly skill-based. You gotta play her a lot. 

I'd also recommend her :) join r/lulumains in reddit. We are a small but friendly community. {{champion:117}}
I will definitely check it out  thanks!

First off at your level you really shouldn't be looking to master a champ yet. Learn the game first, learn the roles, develop map awareness shit like that then work from there. anyways if you want mobility my favorites are zed and lee sin.

I've learned the game, learned the roles, developed map awareness and* shit like that :) League is a game I simply play for fun with friends, Do I want to improve? Of course, but not if it means bucketing down on a champion with intent to master... maybe I just don't sense that competitiveness yet, I would assume that'll come overtime? Or perhaps just at a higher lvl? But yeah, just letting you know that I'm not planning to really master a champion at my level, I am going to be playing for fun with champions I enjoy and if I somehow master them along the way then amen lol.

Ok fair enough. But yeah zed lee sin are both great if you want mobility and playmaking potential. Would stick riven in there too. If you wanted an ap version of that that's ranged, go like leblanc or ahri. Just my opinion.

Yeah... My play style description is limited, I just didn't really know what to say, Is there anything else that I can say? What am I missing that'll help determine my play style?

Do you prefer to back line or get right into the action?   Are you cautious or aggressive?   Are there any themes you enjoy playing?    What champions have you enjoyed playing so far?    Do you have a preferred role you plan to fill?   Are there any play styles you don't like?

It is hard to call but I suppose I play back line incomparsion to my team mates, but then again that because some of them just doesn't understand defense :) I'm for sure not overly aggressive, I am aggressive when I should be... I tend to be cautious at all times, Good at dodging certain things, ganks etc... I'm very aware. Not entirely sure what you mean by themes I enjoy playing; roles? I normally play Bottom because I was playing some supports, I've just recently been playing Mid with Kassadin and I am enjoying it. I did play top sometimes and most weren't that good because I always had to solo top against 2 enemies for the majority of the time and I always had a jungler that sucked and ended up just making it even harder to solo the top... I have enjoyed almost every champions I've played except for Fiddlesticks because so far he just seem like a glass cannon and takes longer to level. Champions that I have played the most are Anivia, Kassadin and Draven (although I haven't played him for awhile) I did enjoy Caitlyn awhile back... I try to remain versatile, I've been playing/trying every champion that comes up as F2P for the week etc... experimenting :)

By theme I meant more in the way of persona.   Personality, Dark/light.   Sometimes people get into champion because of their theatrical appeal.   


At this point I would say just try every champion each rotation like you have been.   However if you like Kass you should try {{champion:7}} {{champion:103}}   While they play differently their overall play styles are similar.   High mobility caster based.
Thx.
I'd recommend Ezreal and Ekko. They're both really mobile, have long range spells, and can be really fun to play.
